title: Coronation Street's Simon Gregson performs shirtless for his birthday
text:
Coronation Street star Simon Gregson looked unrecognisable as he performed a shirtless raunchy birthday song on stage in Manchester on Thursday.

In a now-deleted video recorded by his wife, Emma Gleave, the Steve McDonald actor, who turned 45 on Tuesday, stripped down to his jeans and added a pair of black sparkly feathered wings.

Taking to the stage for a performance to celebrate his birthday, he accessorised his look with a black tombola hat and a pair of white trainers.

Birthday boy: Coronation Street star Simon Gregson looked unrecognisable as he performed a shirtless raunchy birthday song on stage in Manchester on Thursday

Simon gave the performance his all as he took centre stage in the racy ensemble and was later joined by a drag queen.

The Coronation Street legend turned 45 on Tuesday and appeared to be celebrating the milestone with his nearest and dearest later in the week.

Simon's wife, Emma, sweetly took to Instagram on Wednesday to share a gushing post about her husband.

She shared a cosy picture of the two out for dinner, she said: 'Happy birthday to my gorgeous Hubby! 45 today you old g*t........... Looking forward to an evening of cakes and madness!'

While Emma took to Instagram on Thursday night to share updates of their 'birthday date night' with the fun performance video making an appearance before it was deleted.

The mother-of-three also revealed that they attended a comedy show ahead of their evening celebrations.

Simon has been married to his wife Emma for 19 years and the couple are parents to three sons - Alfie, Harry and Teddy.

The couple have previously hit headlines in heartbreaking circumstances after he revealed in 2017 that they had suffered 11 miscarriages.

The show stalwart announced the devastating news on Twitter after a cruel troll approached his wife on the microblogging site.

Simon was in the midst of a storyline in which his character Steve McDonald, who he has played for 30 years, was faced with his ex partner Michelle Connor a suffering a stillbirth - leading to mass controversy from fans.

The Corrie legend has previously divulged limited information about their tragedy after losing Teddy's twin in the early stages of pregnancy, when Emma told OK! magazine: 'Sadly only one of the twins survived. We’re very lucky to have this one.'
